intro: Echinocereus engelmannii var. howei, commonly known as the Howey Hedgehog Cactus, is a species native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a small, spineless cactus with a globular shape and typically grows to a height of 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces yellow flowers in the spring, which are often followed by red, spherical fruits. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun, making it well-suited for arid and semi-arid environments. Its compact size and ornamental flowers make it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
